channel.title: Any way to do this? (wifi fun?)
channel.description:
Okay well this week im working at the great wolf lodge in virginia and they have WiFi all thru out the hotel..
is there any thing i can do with this? and is there anything else i can do to other peoples comp? like just explore with em or w/e?
btw cant remember if this is allowed.. thanks lol

item.title: Any way to do this? (wifi fun?)
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Chances are if you can’t connect then they have it set for limited access from one ip address, too bad you don’t know what it is because you could just change your details too match, soo in short sounds like the person who set up the wireless had a brain. Sorry xD

Oh and ya cmd has the same details.

Read full topic

item.source: Any way to do this? (wifi fun?)

item.title: Any way to do this? (wifi fun?)
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“mvp566, post:7, topic:126285”]lol jme did u forget im a dumbass?

that made no sence lol[/quote]
I assume you meant to say jdb :p, but I’m sorry I was hungover when I wrote that, let me rephrase.

  1. Goto your network connections and double click the connection you are using to connect to the wireless.

  2. Goto the “Support” tab.

  3. Look carefully for “Default Gateway” and write down or remember the ip address next to it.

  4. Open Firefox/IE(I hope not!) and enter the ip address found in step ‘3’.

  5. Now this is where it varies, it should come up with something that looks like a web page but in reality you just connected to the router and are viewing the configuration utility. Look around for something like ‘recent connections’ or ‘security logs’ and save them onto your computer for later use. You can also look for encryption settings and password protect the wireless connection.

The following steps (and the ones above) are illegal [partially] and I take no responsibility for your actions, this post is for education purposes only.

  1. Take the list of ip address’ you have acquired and find a good port scanning software http://www.google.com/search?q=port+scanner to find any holes in there security, this however takes a bit of knowledge of what you are doing and I don’t feel like writing a tutorial lol.

That about all the help i can give at the moment. Your welcome if I helped at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Any way to do this? (wifi fun?)
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

lol yeah, figure out the gateway you are connecting through and input the ip of the router into the web browser, from there it differs from router to router you can get a list of active ips and then port scan them to see if there are any open ports or you be mischievous and change (or encrypt) the encryption being uses. You could also set a login password for router access. Of course you can’t do anything i listed if the admin has a brain.

Read full topic
